content.description:
Start just to the left of Skeletor. Climbing slowly get more difficult the higher you get.  Beth little in the way of rests are offered.  Bolting is a little exciting near the top, but just relax and enjoy the ride.

This route has a reputation for holds breaking, travel lightly and be careful.
To the left of Bushido. Short but bouldery.
Awesome pocket pulling to a distinct crux (pinky mono). Pull though this and hang on through some small holds to a good rest, fun moves to a shared anchor with Bushido. Stellar route!
content.protection: 8/9 bolts to a anchor with clips.
content.location:
Bushido to the left, Hapacholo and the La Cabanita extension to the right.

Climb Mothership into the Bare Knuckle Boxer extension of Bushido and it's Mission Control 13a.

content.description:
A classic line (probably more logical than Bare Knuckle Boxer as the rope line is straighter and the extension is easier than either Bushido or Mothership). Solid for 12d... Maybe 13a if you're shorter or have large fingers?

Climb Mothership. Once you clip the crux bolt, reach down and unclip the previous draw to reduce rope drag. Continue... past the anchor... and past four more bolts to the giant Mothership pod.
content.protection: 13x draws plus an additional one for the intermediate anchor.
content.location: Begin under the right end of the long mid-height roof, continuing to the Mothership pod at the top of the wall. Easy to ID by two prominent, heavily chalked monos.

climbs.name: La Cabanita Especial
climbs.fa: Equipped: Tom Smart FA: Jonathan Siegrist

content.description:
An extension to 'Hapachulo' (13a). After the burly mono crux of Hapachulo follow the rail left with no feet up and left to an okay rest. From here fire into sustained pocket pulling with still poor feet up and straight into a burly move--  rock over, stand-up to a good right hand 2 finger. The crux move is accurate and super long. Sustained 5.12 climbing leads to the chains. Reachy throughout. A rad little route.

Docked a star because of it's close proximity to Mothership...
content.protection: 5 extra bolts to Hapachulo. 12 in total?
content.location: To the right of Mothership, one of the highest routes (furthest right) on the Discovery Wall.

content.description: Starts just to the right of Mothership.  make some big moves with bad feet, find a good rest and do more of that.  Real Hapachulos clip the chains AFTER the finishing mono move! 12+ if clipped from the mono
Short, sequential and thin with cool movement. Riddled with small holds. Choose your own adventure. May need occasional cleaning due to its location in a water streak.
content.location: Uppermost route on the Discovery Wall.

content.description: This is hands down one of the best routes here.  Big moves, good rests! it has it all, techy, dynamic, lock-offs, good/bad feet.  It fully embodies the Fins.  get on it!

climbs.name: Bare Knuckle Boxer
climbs.fa: Equipped: Marc Hanselmen FA: Jonathan Siegrist

content.description:
A wicked extension to Marc's classic, 'Bushido' 13b. After a good rest carry on through rad pocket pulling to the right side of the huge hueco at the top of the wall. Relatively straight forward climbing, adding a nice pump to the top of Bushido.

Probably mid 5.12 in itself -- hard to say that after a good rest it really adds any substantial difficulty, but it certainly adds quality.
